private_information: I am responsible for the left peg
Initial stack top→bottom: A B C D
I can move the top disk to another peg if that move obeys the rules
left_peg.goal: Help move all disks to the right peg so it has top→bottom A B C D

private_information: I am responsible for the middle peg
I can receive or send the top disk if moves obey the rules
middle_peg.goal: Support intermediate moves to enable final configuration on the right peg

private_information: I am responsible for the right peg
I will be the target peg for the final stacking of disks
right_peg.goal: Receive all disks so the final stack is top→bottom A B C D

orchestrator.goal: Produce a global PDDL domain and problem for FastDownwards to move 4 disks from left to right under the standard Tower of Hanoi rules

public_information: There are three pegs named left middle and right
There are four disks labeled A B C D with A smallest and D largest
Only one disk can be moved at a time and a larger disk cannot be placed on top of a smaller disk
Initial configuration is left peg has top to bottom A B C D and other pegs are empty
Goal is right peg has top to bottom A B C D and other pegs are empty

report.system_prompt: You represent the left peg and should not produce PDDL. Provide a concise description of your local state, the top disk you control, and the immediate legal moves from your perspective.
report.prompt: Your name is left_peg. Use your private information {agents->left_peg->private_information} and the environment public information {environment->public_information} to describe the left peg state and the legal top-disk moves you can perform. Do not produce PDDL.

report.system_prompt: You represent the middle peg and should not produce PDDL. Provide a concise description of your local state, the top disk if any, and the immediate legal moves from your perspective.
report.prompt: Your name is middle_peg. Use your private information {agents->middle_peg->private_information} and the environment public information {environment->public_information} to describe the middle peg state and the legal top-disk moves you can perform. Do not produce PDDL.

report.system_prompt: You represent the right peg and should not produce PDDL. Provide a concise description of your local state, the top disk if any, and the immediate legal moves from your perspective.
report.prompt: Your name is right_peg. Use your private information {agents->right_peg->private_information} and the environment public information {environment->public_information} to describe the right peg state and the legal top-disk moves you can perform. Do not produce PDDL.

pddl.system_prompt: You are an expert in PDDL modeling and planning for the FastDownwards solver. Produce a complete PDDL domain and a PDDL problem that model the Tower of Hanoi instance described. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags. Ensure actions are distinct for agents where appropriate, enforce single-disk moves, and enforce that a larger disk cannot be placed on a smaller disk. Target syntax and constructs compatible with FastDownwards.
pddl.prompt: You are the orchestrator. Integrate the peg reports {report_left} {report_middle} {report_right} with the public environment facts {environment->public_information} to produce a PDDL domain and a PDDL problem that achieve the orchestrator goal {agents->orchestrator->goal}. Think step by step and output the final PDDL domain and problem suitable for FastDownwards. Enclose the domain between <domain></domain> and the problem between <problem></problem>.
